result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephan Syree Cannaday was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stephan Syree Cannaday is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stephan Syree Cannaday was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample if one has not previously been provided.
Defendant to pay the DNA surcharge, all court costs, fees and surcharges.  All costs and surharges  are to be paid by the end of the defendant's Extended Supervision.  If not, enter a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to the sentence defendant is currently serving.
As to the victim's request, the Court will consider allowing written contact with the victim and defendant only if the prison would allow it.
Defendant not eligible for any programs.
Court advised defendant that due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephan Syree Cannaday in court with attorney Susan Roth for Steven R. Kohn.  Defendant Stephan Syree Cannaday in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Nicolas Heitman.
cab
    Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel, defendant. Additional statements made by:  Monique C.
Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR consecutive to the sentence he is currently serving.  Credit given for -0- days time served if revoked.
.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 

As to the victim's request the court will consider allowing written contact with the victim and defendant ONLY IF the prison would allow it.
-provide a DNA sample if one has not previously been provided;
-Defendant to pay the DNA surcharge;
-Defendant to pay all court costs, fees and surcharges;
.All costs and surcharges are to be paid by the end of the defendant' s extended supervision, if not enter a civil judgment.

Defendant not eligible for any programs.  Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Acknowledgment of ineligibility  Copies given to defendant.    Court advised defendant that due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Stephan Syree Cannaday in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Defendant Stephan Syree Cannaday in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to Count 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed.
As to Count 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED pending sentencing and ordered that the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department keep the defendant in Milwaukee County until the next court date. Court ordered the jury trial date of 08/24/2015 vacated. Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Steven R. Kohn in court, defendant Stephan Syree Cannaday not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The defendant was not produced for today's date.
The court ordered that the defendant is to be kept either in the Criminal Justice Facility or the House of Correction until the next court date, and not shipped back to Dodge Correctional Institution.
Case adjourned for a plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephan Syree Cannaday in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.

Defendant Stephan Syree Cannaday in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Defendant Stephan Syree Cannaday in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Moeneek H also known as Moeneek C;  Afrishawn D.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Stephan Syree Cannaday in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Stephan Syree Cannaday in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Count 1- Misdemeanor.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Due to trial court being unavailable during the required time frame for the hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am. in Branch PE for Branch 4
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
